item.description:
This will be a mob gathering in front of the public in which YOU will be the performers. It is being setup by the Arts & Ideas Festival and the Out of Hand Theater.  It will take about an hour.  Afterwards we can check out the festival.

IMPORTANT: While this is a free activity, if you do not pre-register, you may have a difficult time participating. To pre-register, go to:
http://artidea.org/group-intelligence and click the "Register Now" button. Register for Sunday (it may rain Saturday; plus, free parking Sunday).

WHAT HAPPENS: You'll gather on the Green, and on your MP3 player (or you can borrow one of the few from the theater company) you will have instructions, music, & narration telling you what to do. You will all follow the instructions...but you won't all have the same instructions! The theme is the interaction of molecules to self-assemble and form life, and intelligence.

After you register, you will at some point get an email (1st batch goes out Friday) with further instructions, including how to get your MP3 player setup (you will not all be emailed the same MP3).

This is an "active" event, so dress appropriately.  The organizers say you should wear closed-toe footwear.  And bring your ticket confirmation number.

WHERE: The meeting point for everyone for this mob (not just our group) is the Festival's Information Pavilion on the Green.  You must arrive by 1:45pm, or earlier.  The Pavilion is the cool chrome-looking structure near the Elm Street main stage (http://artidea.org/sites/default/files/styles/page-main/public/images/main-image/infopavilion.jpg)


If group members want to hang-out after, go to other Arts events (here's the schedule http://artidea.org/calendar), get food whatever, we can do that. On Saturday or Sunday I'll send out a message of what I'll be wearing, also, people can call/text me to find the group.

HOST: Jason, cell # in RSVP.  Texting is fine too
item.how_to_find_us: I'll send out a message of what I'm wearing, or you can call or text me
item.name: Sun. 6/24 - Arts & Ideas Flash mob/interactive performance art
